"""
Baseado nos ensinamentos do Professor Sandeco
https://www.youtube.com/@canalsandeco
"""

from axiestudio.custom import Component
from axiestudio.io import MessageTextInput, Output
from axiestudio.schema import Data
from fpdf import FPDF
import os
import textwrap

class PDFGeneratorComponent(Component):
    display_name = "Formatted PDF Generator"
    description = "Receives a text input and transforms it into a formatted PDF."
    icon = "custom_components"
    
    inputs = [
        MessageTextInput(
            name="pdf_title",
            display_name="PDF Title",
            info="Title of the generated PDF.",
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="text_content",
            display_name="Text Content",
            info="The text content to be included in the PDF.",
        ),
    ]

    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="PDF Creation Status", name="pdf_status", method="create_pdf"),
    ]

    def create_pdf(self) -> Data:
        # Retrieve input values
        pdf_title = self._attributes.get("pdf_title", "Untitled")
        text_content = self._attributes.get("text_content", "")

        # Set up the output file path
        downloads_folder = os.path.join(os.path.expanduser("~"), "Downloads")
        pdf_filename = f"{pdf_title.replace(' ', '_')}.pdf"
        pdf_path = os.path.join(downloads_folder, pdf_filename)

        class JustifiedPDF(FPDF):
            def multi_cell_justified(self, w, h, txt, indent, border=0, align='J', fill=False):
                # Helper function to split text into lines that fit within a given width
                def split_text(text, max_width):
                    words = text.split()
                    lines = []
                    current_line = []
                    current_width = 0
                    for word in words:
                        word_width = self.get_string_width(word + ' ')
                        if current_width + word_width <= max_width:
                            current_line.append(word)
                            current_width += word_width
                        else:
                            if current_line:
                                lines.append(' '.join(current_line))
                            current_line = [word]
                            current_width = word_width
                    if current_line:
                        lines.append(' '.join(current_line))
                    return lines

                # Calculate widths for first line (with indent) and subsequent lines
                first_line_width = w - indent
                first_line = split_text(txt, first_line_width)[0]
                remaining_text = ' '.join(txt.split()[len(first_line.split()):])
                subsequent_lines = split_text(remaining_text, w)
                
                # Process and print the first line with indent
                self.set_x(self.l_margin + indent)
                words = first_line.split()
                word_width = [self.get_string_width(word) for word in words]
                # Calculate space between words to justify the line
                space_width = (first_line_width - sum(word_width)) / (len(words) - 1) if len(words) > 1 else 0
                
                for i, word in enumerate(words):
                    self.cell(word_width[i], h, word, 0, 0, 'L')
                    if i < len(words) - 1:  # Don't add space after the last word
                        self.cell(space_width, h, '', 0, 0, 'L')
                self.ln(h)
                
                # Process and print subsequent lines
                for i, line in enumerate(subsequent_lines):
                    self.set_x(self.l_margin)
                    if i == len(subsequent_lines) - 1:  # Last line
                        self.cell(w, h, line, 0, 1, 'L')  # Align left, don't justify
                    else:
                        words = line.split()
                        word_width = [self.get_string_width(word) for word in words]
                        # Calculate space between words to justify the line
                        space_width = (w - sum(word_width)) / (len(words) - 1) if len(words) > 1 else 0
                        
                        for j, word in enumerate(words):
                            self.cell(word_width[j], h, word, 0, 0, 'L')
                            if j < len(words) - 1:  # Don't add space after the last word
                                self.cell(space_width, h, '', 0, 0, 'L')
                        self.ln(h)

        # Initialize PDF object with custom settings
        pdf = JustifiedPDF()
        pdf.set_left_margin(25)
        pdf.set_right_margin(25)
        pdf.set_auto_page_break(auto=True, margin=25)
        pdf.add_page()

        # Add title to the PDF
        pdf.set_font("Arial", 'B', 16)
        pdf.cell(0, 10, txt=pdf_title, ln=True, align='C')
        pdf.ln(5)

        # Set font for the main content
        pdf.set_font("Arial", size=11)

        # Calculate available width for text
        text_width = pdf.w - pdf.l_margin - pdf.r_margin

        # Process and add content to the PDF
        paragraphs = text_content.split('\n')
        for paragraph in paragraphs:
            if paragraph.strip():
                # Add justified paragraph with first line indent
                pdf.multi_cell_justified(text_width, 6, paragraph.strip(), indent=12)
                pdf.ln(1)  # Space between paragraphs
            else:
                pdf.ln(3)  # Blank line between paragraphs

        # Generate the PDF file
        pdf.output(pdf_path)

        # Attempt to open the PDF file (Windows-specific)
        try:
            os.startfile(pdf_path)
        except Exception as e:
            return Data(data={"status": f"Error: {str(e)}"})

        return Data(data={"status": f"PDF created successfully and opened: {pdf_path}"})
